channel.title: Assamese Students & Scholars Association of America
channel.description: Recent content on Assamese Students & Scholars Association of America

item.title: PhD and Postdoc opportunities
item.description: CORTÉS LAB is hiring PhD and Postdocs PhD: “Transcriptional regulation of adaptation and developmental decisions in malaria parasites: from epigenetic variation to directed transcriptional responses”, Postdoc:“Transcriptional regulation of adaptation and developmental decisions in malaria parasites: from epigenetic variation to directed transcriptional responses” To know more about the recruitment. Click the link: https://cortesmalarialab.wordpress.com/2020/10/12/we-are-hiring/

item.title: Postdoctoral position in quantitative/statistical/population genetics, bioinformatics
item.description: Working Title Post-Doctoral Research Associate Department Agronomy & Horticulture-0827 University of Nebraska - Lincoln, Nebraska, USA Requisition Number F_190182 Posting Open Date 09/30/2019 Application Review Date: (To ensure consideration, please submit all application materials before review date) 10/31/2019 Posting Close Date Open Until Filled Yes Description of Work The Post-Doctoral Research Associate will contribute to the integrated research land-grant mission of the home unit and the IANR, as an effective scholar and citizen, including supporting student recruitment and IANR science literacy.

item.title: Postdoctoral researcher advertisement
item.description: Postdoctoral Research Associate University of Wyoming, Microbial Ecology Collaborative Project Number of position : 12 We are seeking twelve postdoctoral researchers to join our interdisciplinary data science team, spanning multiple research areas in ecology and evolutionary biology. The postdoctoral researchers will join a collaboration among eight faculty at the University of Wyoming, University of Montana, and University of Nevada-Reno, including Drs. Alex Buerkle, Christopher Weiss-Lehman, Lauren Shoemaker, Sarah Collins, and Daniel Laughlin (UW), Joanna Blaszczak and Matt Forister (UNR), and Bob Hall (UM).
